alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield; City of Richmond; Henrico (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 30 at 6:27AM EST until January 30 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... James River At Richmond Westham affecting Henrico, Chesterfield and City of Richmond Counties. For the Lower James Basin...including Richmond Locks, Cartersville, Richmond Westham...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River at Richmond Westham. * WHEN...From this afternoon to this evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flood stage. Minor flooding along both banks. No damage at this level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 11.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.0 feet this afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.0 feet on 02/05/2016. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 630 PM EST.
